div.l: A cheffeld twetill bare he bi his hose
Rounde swassaswas his face and kammysh his nose
And pilled as a nape was his sculle
He was a market beter atte full
Þer͗e durst no wight hande on hīm legge
Þat he ne sware he shuld a none abigge
A þeef he was for soth of corne ⁊and mele
And þat a slegh and vsant for to stele
His name was called daynous Symkyn̄
A wife he had cōmmen of ful noble kyn̄
The ꝑpersone of þe towne hir fader was
With hir he yaf ful many a pan a bras
For þat Symkyn shuld in his hert blode Alye
She was suffred in a nonrie
For Symkyn wold no wife as he seid
But she were nortered as a maide
To saue his estate of yomanry
And she was proude and perte as is a pie
A ful fair͗e sight was on þeim two
On holiday before hir͗e wold he go
With his tipped wounded aboute his hede
And she cam aftre in a gite of rede
And Symkyn̄ had hosen of þe same
There durst no wife call hir͗e but madame
Was none so hardy þat went bi þe wey
With hir durst rage or onys pley
But if he wold be slayn of Symkyn̄
With panade or knyfe or botkyn̄
For Ielous folk is ꝑperlous euer͗e mo
Algate þei wold her͗e wifes wend so
And eke for she was somdele smoterliche
She was as digne as water in a diche
As ful of hoker and bismare
Hir þought a ladi shuld hir͗e spare
What for hir kinrede and hir nortri
A doughter had þey betwix hem two
Of xx yere age with outen ony mo
Saueying a childe þat
was a ꝓpropre page
This wenche thik and wel growen̄ was
With cammysh nose and eyen grei as glas
With botox brode and brest rounde and hie
But right faire was hir hede I wil not lye
The ꝑperson of þe towne for she was faire
